str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To please, with the idea of willing service rendered to others; hence almost: I serve. Probably from airo; to be agreeable.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular

str2: But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
According to the manner in which, in the degree that, just as, as. From kata and hos; just as, that.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; to 'grave', especially to write; figuratively, to describe.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: To reproach, revile, upbraid. From oneidos; to defame, i.e. Rail at, chide, taunt.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To fall upon, press upon, light upon, come over. From epi and pipto; to embrace or seize.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
